name: Crusader
description: The Crusader, Steel Core's CQC Striker mech, wasn't born from Etsio’s hands but from his mind. Etsio directed its creation with a singular vision: a machine built for front-line domination, designed to survive the harshest of engagements and turn the tide in close-quarters combat. He was notorious for sitting down with STC’s top engineers, not to micromanage the technical details, but to lay down the essence of what the Crusader needed to be—a relentless, unstoppable force. “If it can’t take a hit, I don’t want it,” he famously declared. This led to the Crusader’s thick armor and the integration of the Shock Shield, ensuring it could shrug off the heaviest blows and explosive damage. Etsio envisioned the Crusader as a juggernaut in melee combat. He didn’t care for long-range artillery, so the engineers crafted the Pile Bunker, a tungsten spike launcher capable of punching through any armor and finishing foes with ruthless efficiency. The integration of the Blitz Core into the Crusader was Etsio’s crowning touch. He demanded a system that would let the Crusader charge across the battlefield, disregarding enemy reactions and tearing through defenses. The Blitz Core perfectly encapsulated his philosophy: never stop moving, never stop attacking. With the core active, the Crusader became a blur of destructive energy, knocking down enemies and delivering punishing hits with enhanced speed.

traits.name: Guardian
traits.description: Adjacent allied characters can use the mech for hard cover.

traits.name: Shock Shield
traits.description: The Mech has resistance explosive AOE damage.

traits.name: Trophy System
traits.description: An integrated automatic AI system that targets incoming rounds, launching counterfire to intercept them to potentially take no damage.

actions.name: Activate Trophy System
actions.detail:
The Trophy System attempts to intercept incoming attacks. 2/Round.

Requires an d20+GRIT(Is also effected by Bolster) roll higher than enemies attack roll for it to negate said attack.

Does not work against SMART weapons, Flamer weapons.

core_system.name: Blitz Core
core_system.active_effect: Crusader charges in a straight line using its current movement + 4, ignoring reactions, dragging all characters in its path to the endpoint. Those dragged must make a Hull Save or be knocked Prone. It can use Pile Bunker once as a free action, ignoring the loading trait. If it kills the target, it can immediately charge equal to your current speed to a new target as a reaction. The charge itself deals no damage, but all attacks while Blitz Core is active have Reliable 4. Crusader gains 1d3 HEAT per turn while this ability is active.
core_system.description: The core goes into hyperdrive, increasing speed in all forms exponentially. Select a target (preferably someone in the backline), you charge into melee with said mech, pushing through any and all mechs of equal or smaller size. Max range equal to max speed.

name: Monitor
description:
Developed as a pet project by 53R3N17Y, also known as Alva Sol, a notorious hacker with a reputation across the galaxy for her cyber-warfare prowess, the Monitor was designed to reflect her unique combat philosophy: control through superior information. The Monitor’s systems allow it to engage multiple enemies simultaneously, overwhelming their defenses with intrusive hacks and deep scans while feeding critical data to its allies. Unlike many combat mechs, the Monitor isn't meant to dominate through raw power but through its ability to predict, scan, and neutralize threats before they can act. Rumored to have been inspired by the advanced technology of Concord enforcement mechs in the outer reaches, the Monitor combines cutting-edge sensor arrays with powerful tech-driven assaults that can disable entire squadrons with little more than a few well-timed commands. Alva Sol, incorporated her personal system to amplify her invasive techniques. Her signature ability, the Obfuscation Manifold, overloads her sensor suite to such an extent that
she can bend the very fabric of cyber space becoming a ghost in the battlefield while orchestrating devastating digital strikes. Many have underestimated the Monitor's potential due to its small size and support role, only to find themselves overwhelmed by its near-limitless sensor range and the withering heat assaults generated by its hacking shards.

traits.name: Fragile
traits.description: Gain +1 difficulty on Hull and Engineering checks and saves.

traits.name: Scout Frame
traits.description: Ignores difficult terrain

traits.name: Data Siphon
traits.description: Whenever the Monitor makes a tech attack against a hostile character, it may also automatically Scan them.

traits.name: Full-Spectrum Sensor Suite
traits.description: The Monitor may Lock On as a protocol.

traits.name: Intergrated Sensor Booster and Targeting System.
traits.description: The monitior has an intergraded Sensor Booster and Targeting System. You may not add more to the frame.

core_system.name: Dissolution Sequencer
core_system.active_effect:
Gain 5 Sensor range. Gain access to special tech options
[unleashed shall i be and they will only know darkness henceforth]
core_system.description: All systems and sensor boosters overload increasing the mechs offensive tech abilities.

active_actions.name: ENHANCE
active_actions.detail: When you ENHANCE, you use your mech’s formidable processing power to enhance another character’s systems. To ENHANCE, choose a character within SENSORS. They receive +2 Accuracy on on all actions they make between now and the end of their next turn. Characters can only benefit from one ENHANCE at a time.

active_actions.name: Star Killer
active_actions.detail: 2/Scene choose a target to start having a reactor meltdown. Unless they shutdown their mech they will blow up at the end of the next round.

core_system.passive_effect: Gain access to 53R3N17Y's custom hacking shards

passive_actions.name: Intrusive Thoughts
passive_actions.detail:
The Monitor makes a tech attack against a character. On a success, the target immediately as a reaction uses a weapon chosen by the Monitor to attack a character within Range.
[It is a man's own mind not his enemy or foe that lures him to evil ways].

name: Mariana
description: Named after the Mariana Trench, the deepest point on Earth, the Mariana reflects GMS’s commitment to creating a frame capable of operating under immense pressure—both literal and metaphorical. This frame is designed for those who need more than just durability and firepower; it’s for Lancers who demand flexibility in the chaos of battle. Whether fighting in open space or in the depths of alien environments, the Mariana can handle it all. GMS saw the success of the Everest and decided to push the limits of what a standard frame could offer. The Mariana was designed to be the Everest MK II, incorporating years of field data, pilot feedback, and evolving battlefield needs. It's not just a frame for rookies learning the ropes—it’s built for seasoned veterans who need a platform that can be fine-tuned to their unique combat style. The inclusion of enhanced mod slots and more streamlined repair capabilities ensures that the Mariana can be refitted and rearmed with ease, making it ideal for extended campaigns where support might be limited.

traits.name: Replaceable parts
traits.description: While resting, the Mariana can be repaired at a rate of 1 Repair per 1 structure damage, instead of 2 Repairs.

traits.name: Durable Boosters
traits.description: The Mariana has a propulsion system suitable for use in low or zero gravity and underwater environments. In those environments, you can fly and are not Slowed. You may also boost as a free action while not using the boosters as a EVA.

traits.name: In-Built Redundancy
traits.description: The Mariana has many in built systems and mounts that allow it to ignore all effects from the first structure damage it takes.

core_system.name: 'Everest' COMP/CON
core_system.active_effect: Choose one of the two protocol's
core_system.description: The mech has an inbuilt advanced comp/con unit to assist in piloting the mech and any other side actions to make the the job of the pilot easier. This AI does not count to your total AI count and can be replaced with an NHP to create a variant personal mech.
core_system.passive_effect: When your mech is destroyed due to a failed structure save, the pilot automatically ejects and lands within range 8 (your choice of location). The mech then regains full HP and stays active for 2 rounds as an autonomous unit, prioritizing any immediate threats to the pilot. Once the 2 rounds are up the mech falls on the spot having completed it duty.

active_actions.name: Protocol 1 - Engage Defensive Maneuvers
active_actions.trigger: When hit with an ranged/melee attack
active_actions.detail: Activate the Everest's advanced evasion subroutines, granting your mech +2 Evasion for the next 2 rounds.

active_actions.name: Protocol 2 - Offensive Override
active_actions.detail: Once Protocol 2 is activated Barrage becomes a quick action for only two instances until the end of the next round.

traits.name: Heavy Frame
traits.description: The Naga can’t be pushed, pulled, knocked Prone, or knocked back by smaller characters.

traits.name: Thermal Plating
traits.description: The Naga has resistance to HEAT Damage from weapons.

traits.name: Colossus
traits.description: Adjacent allied characters can use the Naga for hard cover.

traits.name: Slow
traits.description: The Naga receives +1 difficulty on Agility checks and saves.

synergies.detail: The Naga receives +1 difficulty on Agility checks and saves.

core_system.name: Mortal Reminder
core_system.active_name: Set up to next stage/ Charge Railgun
core_system.active_effect: When activated you start setting up your railgun. Any disruptions require you to make a 13+ D20+GRIT save otherwise you take the HEAT damage and have to start charge from 0

name: Thalia
description: The Thalia frame, forged by the Union's finest engineers, was conceived as the ultimate battlefield medic, offering frontline repairs to allies in critical moments. Named after the ancient figure of grace and rejuvenation, Thalia embodies a dual philosophy: combining durability with unparalleled support capabilities to sustain allies in even the most hostile conditions. Originally developed during a series of brutal campaigns, the Thalia became essential in long battles where repair stations were scarce. Steel Core engineers equipped it with breakthrough technology, including the Integrity Response Drone System (IRDS) and Remote Automated Armor Restoration (RAAR), enabling it to provide rapid, in-field repair without compromising its own combat capabilities. These systems were an innovation in field support: the IRDS drone could be deployed to handle repairs autonomously while the pilot attended to more urgent matters, while the RAAR enabled Thalia to shore up the defenses of critically damaged mechs and restore operational efficiency in seconds.

traits.name: Combat medic
traits.description: Thalia and all allies adjacent to the Thalia gain +1 accuracy to HULL, SYSTEM and ENGINEERING saving throws.

traits.name: Assisted Repair
traits.description: as a prepared action Thalia may give adjacent allies the quick action to repair to full HP Or recover 1 Structure damage and return to 1 HP.  (The ally uses their own repair cap at their regular cost for HP repair and for structure double the amount.)

traits.name: Intergrated IRDS and RAAR
traits.description: You gain 2 intergrated Systems. RAAR Thalia Variant and IRDS Thalia Variant.

core_system.name: Cryptbloom
core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the encounter the Thalia may use any repair actions twice as a quick action. Or you may choose as a full action to repair an ally's system or weapon using 1 RAAR charge.

name: Castle
description: GMS initially introduced the Castle with a vibrant color scheme during its limited prototype phase, intending to market the mech as not just a tool of war, but a symbol of protection and leadership. The colors were inspired by ancient myths of heroic defenders, drawing comparisons to knightly heraldry from Old Terra. However, the flashy design sparked controversy within the utilitarian GMS community. Critics claimed it was unnecessary for a mech designed for mass production and versatility. Originally developed under the codename Fortress Adaptive Deployment Frame (FADF), the Castle was part of a GMS initiative to appeal to security contractors, planetary defense forces, and humanitarian organizations requiring mobile, heavy-duty protection platforms. However, budget overruns, logistical delays, and skepticism about its specialized role and flashy design led to the project being quietly shelved for years. Despite this, several prototypes were distributed to field testers, and the results spoke for themselves—wherever the Castle stood, its allies did not fall.

traits.name: Unyielding Defense
traits.description: The Castle can Brace without penalties, then has a 1-round cooldown before using this trait again, though it can still use a regular Brace during the cooldown.

traits.name: Heavy Frame
traits.description: The Castle can’t be pushed, pulled, knocked Prone, or knocked back by smaller characters.

traits.name: Slow
traits.description: The Castle receives +1 difficulty on Agility checks and saves.

traits.name: Aggressive Taunt
traits.description: As a Quick Action, this mech can force an enemy within sensor range to make a Systems Save. If the enemy fails, it becomes Taunted until the end of Castle's next turn. A Taunted enemy has +2 difficulty on all attack rolls against targets other than Castle. This ability can only be active on one character.

core_system.name: Defiance Core
core_system.active_effect: 1/scene this core can be activated, so whenever The Castle Braces, it gains 10 Overshield and Aggressive Taunt now affects all enemies within sensor range for 2 rounds .
core_system.description: he Defiance Core exploits enemy targeting and sensory systems, rerouting hostile focus to the Castle through powerful interference signals compelling them to view the Castle as their primary threat. At the same time this system cloaks the Castle's large shield in a shimmering, protective energy field.
